snippet: The chief human rights official, Navi Pillay, pointed to North Korea’s political prison camps, which she said punish people for peaceful activities and use other forms of cruel treatment.
abstract: Navi Pillay, chief United Nations human rights official, calls for international inquiry into human rights offenses committed by North Korean government over many decades, including torture and executions of people held in country's political prison camps.
lead_paragraph: The chief human rights official, Navi Pillay, pointed to North Korea’s political prison camps, which she said punish people for peaceful activities and use other forms of cruel treatment.

headline.seo: U.N. Human Rights Chief Seeks Investigation of North Korea
headline.main: U.N. Official Urges Scrutiny of North Korea
headline.print_headline: U.N. Official Urges Scrutiny Of North Korea

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
